coding_problems.title: Two Sum
coding_problems.description: Given an array of integers nums and an integer target, return the indices of the two numbers that add up to target. You may assume that each input has exactly one solution, and you may not use the same element twice. You can return the answer in any order.

examples.explanation: The sum of 2 and 7 is 9. Therefore, index0 and index1 are returned.

coding_problems.title: Merge Intervals
coding_problems.description: Given an array of intervals where intervals[i] = [starti, endi], merge all overlapping intervals, and return an array of the non-overlapping intervals that cover all the intervals in the input.

coding_problems.title: Maximum Product Subarray
coding_problems.description: Given an integer array nums, find a contiguous non-empty subarray that has the largest product, and return the product. A subarray is a contiguous subsequence of the array.

coding_problems.title: Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters
coding_problems.description: Given a string s, find the length of the longest substring without repeating characters.
constraints: s consists of English letters, digits, symbols and spaces

examples.explanation: The answer is "abc", with the length of 3.
The answer is "b", with the length of 1.
The answer is "wke", with the length of 3.

coding_problems.title: Median of Two Sorted Arrays
coding_problems.description: Given two sorted arrays nums1 and nums2 of size m and n respectively, return the median of the two sorted arrays. The overall run time complexity should be O(log(min(m,n))).

coding_problems.title: LRU Cache
coding_problems.description: Design a data structure that follows the constraints of a Least Recently Used (LRU) cache. Implement the LRUCache class with get(key) and put(key, value) methods, both run in O(1) time average.

examples.input: LRUCache(2); put(1, 1); put(2, 2); get(1) returns 1; put(3, 3); get(2) returns -1

coding_problems.title: Word Ladder
coding_problems.description: Given two words, beginWord and endWord, and a dictionary wordList, return the number of words in the shortest transformation sequence from beginWord to endWord, or 0 if no such sequence exists.

examples.explanation: One shortest transformation sequence is "hit" -> "hot" -> "dot" -> "dog" -> "cog", which is 5 words long.

coding_problems.title: Trapping Rain Water
coding_problems.description: Given n non-negative integers representing an elevation map where the width of each bar is 1, compute how much water it can trap after raining.

system_design_topics.title: Design URL Shortener (like TinyURL)
system_design_topics.description: Design a system that converts a long URL to a short URL and vice versa.
requirements: Convert a long URL to a short URL
Convert a short URL to the original URL
discussion_points: Unique ID generation (Base62 encoding, hash functions)

company_specific.google_sde: Focus on distributed hash functions and load balancing
company_specific.amazon_l5: Focus on scalability, monitoring, and ops aspects

system_design_topics.title: Design Cache System (LRU)
system_design_topics.description: Design an in-memory cache system with LRU eviction policy.
requirements: Implement get(key) and put(key, value) methods
Both operations should run in O(1) time
Support capacity limit and LRU eviction

company_specific.google_senior: Focus on concurrent algorithms and lock-free designs

system_design_topics.title: Design Chat System
system_design_topics.description: Design a real-time chat system like WhatsApp or Facebook Messenger.
requirements: Scalable to millions of concurrent users

system_design_topics.title: Design Video Streaming Service (YouTube)
system_design_topics.description: Design a video streaming service like YouTube.
requirements: Handle billions of views per day

behavioral_questions.question: Tell me about yourself and your background in software engineering.
tips: Start with your name and current role
End with interest in the role

behavioral_questions.question: Describe a situation where you had a conflict with a colleague. How did you resolve it?
tips: Use STAR method (Situation, Task, Action, Result)
Avoid being overly critical of the other person

behavioral_questions.question: Give an example of when you led a team or took initiative on a project.
tips: Highlight how you motivated the team

behavioral_questions.question: Tell me about a time you failed. What did you learn from it?
Describe your most challenging technical problem you've solved.
tips: Pick a problem that's relevant to the role
Highlight the impact of your solution

behavioral_questions.question: How do you approach collaboration with non-technical stakeholders?
tips: Highlight how you simplified complex concepts

behavioral_questions.question: How do you handle ambiguous requirements or unclear specifications?
How do you approach code reviews? Give an example of constructive feedback you provided.
tips: Focus on code quality and maintainability

behavioral_questions.question: Tell me about a time you had to meet a tight deadline. How did you handle it?
Why are you interested in working at [Company]?
tips: Align your values with company mission
